definition: to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: Violate the precepts, commandments broken Buddhas system.
and the smaller sectionals that are called precepts.
sentences.chinese: 又评估比较小型的，称为戒律的课程。

sentences.english: I shook off the discipline of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我抛弃了城里的那些清规戒律。

sentences.english: That is the basis of the Ten Commandments.
Some Judaic disciplines possessed the function of life nourishment and health care.
sentences.chinese: 犹太教的一些戒律具有养生保健作用。

sentences.english: Nevertheless , reform judaism does not follow these restrictions.
sentences.chinese: 不过，犹太教的改革派却不受这些清规戒律的约束。

sentences.english: All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments." (Matthew 22:35-40)
sentences.chinese: 所有的法律与预言都基于这两条戒律。

sentences.english: If you come up with your own set, please consider posting them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你列出了自己的戒律，请考虑贴上来。
这就是“似非而是十大戒律”。

sentences.english: How is one a precept-breaking mixed-up priest?
sentences.chinese: 如何是一个人破坏戒律的混杂教士？

sentences.english: Now about the apostles and prophets, act in line with the gospel precept.
sentences.chinese: 使徒和先知，他们的行为要符合福音里的戒律。

sentences.english: If not uphold the precepts, vertical attend contribution has also demons heretics.
sentences.chinese: 若不持戒律，纵修习有成，亦是天魔外道。

sentences.english: So left-home people, wherever they may be, must sternly guard their precepts.
sentences.chinese: 所以，出家人处处要严守戒律。

sentences.english: I've practised yoga, studied Zen and followed many religious disciples.
sentences.chinese: 我练过瑜伽，学过禅修，遵循过很多宗教戒律。

sentences.english: So you would not break the third commandment.
sentences.chinese: 那么你就不会违反第三条戒律。

definition: (Buddhism) to adhere strictly to the ethical precepts/asceticism
to go against the rules (of a religious order)/to break a ban (e.g. medical)
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
